games.name: 1001 Spikes
games.description: 1001 Spikes is nightmarishly tough but impossible to put down. It's a treat for retro fans and hardcore masochists.

games.name: 100ft Robot Golf
games.description: 100ft Robot Golf is neither a good golf game, nor a good giant robot game.

games.name: A Hat in Time
games.description: A Hat in Time is an adorable homage to the heyday of 3D platformers that manages to pull a few fun tricks from its hat.

games.name: AO Tennis
games.description: AO Tennis is an underdeveloped and under-featured simulation of the sport.

games.name: Abzu
games.description: Abzu relishes in giving you freedom to enjoy exploring the fascinating deep blue sea.

games.name: Agents of Mayhem
games.description: With fun combat and a likable cast, Agents of Mayhem leans too heavily on repetitive fights to be truly heroic.

games.name: Agony
games.description: Agony is agonizing in all the wrong ways. The painful gameplay takes the gruesome joy out of its disturbing imagery.

games.name: Alien: Isolation
games.description: Alien: Isolation erases the memory of Colonial Marines, but it's still not the great Alien game we were hoping for.

games.name: Alienation
games.description: Alienation picks up the pace, turns up the color, and builds on the progression systems of its predecessor beautifully.

games.name: Amplitude
games.description: This HD remake nails the rhythm-based gameplay, but comes up short with its one-note soundtrack and lack of modes.

games.name: Ancestors Legacy
games.description: Ancestors Legacy scratches the itch for a traditional RTS, but underdelivers on its promise of historical accuracy.

games.name: Another World: 20th Anniversary
games.description: Another World is considered a classic from a golden era of games. I have no idea why.

games.name: Ashes Cricket
games.description: Ashes Cricket isn’t pitch perfect, but it’s the best videogame representation of the sport to date.

games.name: Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag
games.description: Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag is a gorgeous, fantastic sequel that gives you the freedom to make your own fun.

games.name: Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag Freedom Cry
games.description: Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag Freedom Cry tells a great, emotional story in the shell of classic AC gameplay.

games.name: Assassin's Creed Chronicles: China
games.description: Assassin's Creed Chronicles: China does a lot of the hard stuff well, but can't convey the rush of being an assassin.

games.name: Assassin's Creed Origins: The Curse of the Pharaohs DLC
games.description: Assassin's Creed Origins: The Curse of the Pharaohs' journey into Egyptian mythology has a detailed story, challenging combat, and surreal afterlife worlds.

games.name: Assassin's Creed Origins: The Hidden Ones DLC
games.description: Assassin's Creed Origins: The Hidden Ones makes great use of the main game's mechanics to create high-level challenge.

games.name: Assassin's Creed Syndicate
games.description: Syndicate pushes its thick lore into the background and delivers the most fun and focussed Assassin's game in a while.

games.name: Assassin's Creed Unity
games.description: Assassin's Creed Unity is a gorgeous and entertaining game of impossible peaks and disappointing valleys.

games.name: Assetto Corsa PS4/Xbox One
games.description: Assetto Corsa is an amazing driving simulator but it's not a very good racing simulator.

games.name: Attack on Titan
games.description: Though the epilogue has some serious pacing problems, Attack on Titan is a fun, bloody take on the series.

games.name: Attack on Titan 2
games.description: Small changes go a long way toward improving Attack on Titan 2's gameplay, but a poorly paced story and recycled content weigh it down.

games.name: Axiom Verge
games.description: Axiom Verge isn’t a perfect homage to Metroid, but we still enjoyed our time in this strange, familiar world.

games.name: Basement Crawl
games.description: Basement Crawl is a limp, poorly presented, and broken Bomberman clone, and easily the worst PS4 game to date.

games.name: Batman: Arkham Knight
games.description: Batman: Arkham Knight is an impressive game on almost every level, with non-stop variety and great action.

games.name: Batman: Arkham Knight - Catwoman's Revenge DLC
games.description: A fun distraction, but a distraction is all this is.

games.name: Batman: Arkham VR
games.description: Batman: Arkham VR puts you in Rocksteady's universe and enhances detective work, but Batman's physical side is lacking.

games.name: Battleborn
games.description: Battleborn's fun heroes and leveling will keep you hooked despite a lack of content.

games.name: Battlefield 1: Apocalypse DLC
games.description: Battlefield 1: Apocalypse brings some beautiful new ground maps, even if its Air Assault mode is less interesting.

games.name: Battlefield 4 PS4
games.description: Battlefield 4’s devastating destruction is an interesting, imperfect addition to its excellent multiplayer.

games.name: Battlefield Hardline
games.description: Battlefield's first foray into stealth makes for a fresh campaign, and the multiplayer has something for everyone.

games.name: Battlestar Galactica: Deadlock
games.description: Better late than never, Battlestar Galactica gets the smart starship tactics game it deserved in BSG: Deadlock.

games.name: Battlezone VR
games.description: Battlezone VR makes a solid first impression, but its shallow combat and limp weaponry make the enjoyment short-lived.

games.name: Berserk and the Band of the Hawk
games.description: Berserk fits the Dynasty Warriors mold well in Band of the Hawk, but the too-easy combat still gets very repetitive.

games.name: Beyond Eyes
games.description: Beyond Eyes has a fascinating premise and a lot of potential, but its bare-bones plot just isn’t up to the task.

games.name: BioShock: The Collection
games.description: BioShock: The Collection is a great introduction for newcomers, but returning vets will find little new here.

games.name: Black: The Fall
games.description: Black: The Fall Is a blatant, so-so clone of Playdead's 2016 masterpiece.

games.name: BlazBlue Cross Tag Battle
games.description: BlazBlue Cross Tag Battle's mixture of fighting games leads to a surprisingly approachable entry point into the genre.

games.name: Bloodborne
games.description: Bloodborne delivers an exhausting and exhilarating journey into the depths of madness.

games.name: Bloodborne: The Old Hunters
games.description: A dense, intriguing, but ultimately safe expansion, The Old Hunters is more of the same brutal Bloodborne experience.

games.name: Bloodstained: Curse of the Moon
games.description: Bloodstained: Curse of the Moon is a Castlevania III homage that plays dangerously close to its source material, but introduces interesting ideas that make it highly replayable.

games.name: Blue Estate
games.description: Blue Estate is a by-the-numbers rail shooter with gameplay that's just as outdated as its social politics.

games.name: Borderlands: The Handsome Collection
games.description: The Handsome Collection wraps up six years-worth of great Borderlands content and puts a nice bow on it.

games.name: Bound
games.description: Bound is a gorgeous and emotional PS4 platformer that stumbles a bit, but still manages to maintain its grace.

games.name: Bound by Flame
games.description: While parts of Bound By Flame are messy, its combat is strong enough to keep the fire stoked.

games.name: Bubsy: The Woolies Strike Back
games.description: Bubsy: The Woolies Strike Back revives a dormant platforming adventurer… and he’s welcome to leave again any time now.

games.name: Bulletstorm: Full Clip Edition
games.description: A welcome visual upgrade to 2011's shooter, it's just a shame there aren't more extras in this package.

games.name: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
games.description: Advanced Warfare is faster and more focused than any Call of Duty before it.

games.name: Call of Duty: Black Ops 3
games.description: With fun 4-player co-op, new powers, and a fleshed out Zombies mode, Black Ops 3 is the biggest Call of Duty game yet.

games.name: Call of Duty: Ghosts
games.description: Call of Duty: Ghosts' robust multiplayer suite and refreshingly varied campaign make it one of the best in the series.

games.name: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare Remastered
games.description: Modern Warfare Remastered brings a significant graphical upgrade to the classic shooter.

games.name: Call of Duty: WW2 - The War Machine DLC
games.description: The War Machine is an uneven DLC with a great new multiplayer map and Zombies chapter but unfortunate issues elsewhere.

games.name: Call of Duty: WWII - The Resistance DLC
games.description: CoD: WW2's The Resistance DLC offers some needed multiplayer map variety and introduces a challenging new Zombies chapter.

games.name: Carmageddon: Max Damage
games.description: Carmageddon: Max Damage feels like it was designed in and for the year 1999, which doesn’t work in 2016.

games.name: Celeste
games.description: Celeste’s incredible platforming, innumerable secrets, and emotionally genuine story make it a surprise triumph.

games.name: Child of Light
games.description: With its gorgeous art, exemplary combat, and hand-crafted aesthetic, no RPG fan should miss Child of Light.

games.name: Citizens of Earth
games.description: Citizens of Earth is a quirky game with its heart in the right place and its head in the clouds.

games.name: City of Brass
games.description: Clumsy, maddeningly difficult first-person rogue-lite City of Brass will exhaust the patience of all but the most obstinate gluttons for suffering.

games.name: Contrast
games.description: Contrast is a game full of heart, beauty, and at least a few excellent puzzles.

games.name: Costume Quest 2 Console
games.description: Costume Quest 2 improves on the first's combat and funny campaign, but the health and navigation systems need a revamp.

games.name: CounterSpy
games.description: Cold War-esque side-scroller CounterSpy has a great concept and a lot heart, and also a few issues worth noting.

games.name: Crash Bandicoot N. Sane Trilogy
games.description: Largely standing the test of time mechanically, Crash’s first outings get an N. credible facelift in this collection.

games.name: Crimsonland
games.description: Crimsonland’s shooting is repetitive, yet addictive, especially when you're keeping an eye on the online leaderboards.

games.name: Crisis on the Planet of the Apes VR
games.description: Simian VR shooter Crisis On the Planet of the Apes is repetitive, faulty, and more dated than the original Charlton Heston movie.

games.name: DC Universe Online
games.description: DC Universe Online is the best super-hero MMO out there and well worth the free download on PS4.

games.name: Danganronpa V3
games.description: Danganronpa V3’s mix of murder mystery and character interaction makes for a wild, engaging, and unforgettable game.

games.name: Danger Zone
games.description: For better and for worse, Danger Zone is a no-frills resurrection of Burnout’s Crash mode, priced accordingly.

games.name: Dark Souls 3
games.description: Dark Souls 3's incredible world and awe-inspiring weapon arts make it the fiercest installment yet.

games.name: Dark Souls 3: Ashes of Ariandel
games.description: Dark Souls 3: Ashes of Ariandel provides a good challenge in both PvP and PvE, but the latter ends quickly.

games.name: Dark Souls 3: The Ringed City
games.description: Dark Souls 3: The Ringed City's fun twists and turns and terrifying bosses are a satisfying conclusion to the trilogy.

games.name: Dark Souls Remastered
games.description: The power of current-generation consoles gives Dark Souls Remastered the smooth framerate it always needed.

games.name: Darksiders 2: Deathinitive Edition
games.description: If you haven't played Darksiders 2, the Deathinitive Edition is the best way to do so.

games.name: Daylight
games.description: Daylight's horror atmosphere starts strong, but repetitive corridors and nonthreatening enemies squander it quickly.

games.name: Dead Island Definitive Collection
games.description: The Dead Island Definitive Collection looks better than ever, but leaves room for improvement in areas like frame rate.

games.name: Dead Nation: Apocalypse Edition
games.description: Dead Nation brings Housemarque's acclaimed PS3 game to PlayStation 4. And it's as fun -- and difficult -- as ever.

games.name: Dead Rising Triple Pack
games.description: The Dead Rising Triple Pack is the best looking console versions of these games to date but not much more than that.

games.name: Dead Star
games.description: Shifty matchmaking can lead to some frustrating experiences, but overall, Dead Star is a fun MOBA/twin-stick mash-up.

games.name: Dead or Alive 5: Last Round
games.description: Last Round has all of Dead or Alive 5's fighting prowess, but an overload of glitches and fan service hold it back.

games.name: Destiny
games.description: Destiny looks and plays wonderfully, but too many of the other promises it makes get left unfulfilled.

games.name: Destiny 2
games.description: Destiny 2's excellent co-op and competitive shooting, rewarding loot, and strong social elements will keep us playing.

games.name: Destiny 2: Curse of Osiris
games.description: The Curse of Osiris' poor campaign and mostly weak additions do little to address the problems with Destiny 2.

games.name: Destiny: House of Wolves
games.description: Destiny: House of Wolves is a step in the right direction for Bungie's online shooter.

games.name: Destiny: Rise of Iron
games.description: Destiny: Rise of Iron brings more of the same without improving on what came before it.

games.name: Destiny: The Dark Below
games.description: Short on content, and long on grinding, The Dark Below fails to meaningfully enhance the Destiny experience.

games.name: Destiny: The Taken King
games.description: Destiny: The Taken King is an awesome upgrade with many quests to keep me busy long after the campaign has ended.

games.name: Detroit: Become Human
games.description: Detroit: Become Human is a wonderfully silly interactive drama that meaningfully bends to your will.

games.name: Deus Ex Mankind Divided: System Rift
games.description: System Rift suggests a cool new direction for  Deus Ex: Mankind Divided, but it doesn't tell a full story of its own.

games.name: Deus Ex: Mankind Divided
games.description: Layered, intelligent, and impeccably designed, Deus Ex: Mankind Divided's gameplay rewards curiosity and creativity.

games.name: Devil May Cry 4: Special Edition
games.description: Devil May Cry 4: Special Edition's new playable characters are fun, but the flaws of the original game remain intact.

games.name: Diablo 3: Ultimate Evil Edition
games.description: Flush with content and prettier than ever, Ultimate Evil Edition is the best way to experience Diablo 3.

games.name: Dirt 4
games.description: Accessible yet tough and grimy yet gorgeous, Dirt 4 sets a new standard in rally racing. Absolutely stonking brilliant.

games.name: Dirt Rally
games.description: Dirt Rally is a brilliant sim that looks, feels, and sounds absolutely outstanding, but it won’t tolerate the timid.

games.name: Disgaea 5: Alliance of Vengeance
games.description: Though it still  feels a little familiar, Disgaea 5 freshens up its excellent gameplay with some fun new features.

games.name: Dishonored Definitive Edition
games.description: Dishonored Definitive Edition doesn’t live up to its name, but the core game and its DLC are still stylish and fun.

games.name: Dishonored: Death of the Outsider
games.description: Death of the Outsider is a fitting end to a great story that shakes things up but still scratches the Dishonored itch.

games.name: Disney Afternoon Collection
games.description: The Disney Afternoon Collection resurrects a few NES classics (and some not-so-classics) with a great rewind button.

games.name: Disney Infinity 2.0: Marvel Super Heroes
games.description: Disney Infinity 2.0 has a lot of improvements, Toy Box is still great, but it doesn't feel like a major upgrade.

games.name: Disney Infinity 3.0
games.description: Disney Infinity 3.0 is the most polished, cohesive and enjoyable game in the series so far.

games.name: Dissidia Final Fantasy NT
games.description: Dissidia Final Fantasy NT is a strange game. When its team-based battles work it can be great, but it's hard to follow.

games.name: Divide
games.description: Divide is a buggy twin-stick isometric RPG with poor variety, but a cool story to tell.

games.name: Divinity: Original Sin Enhanced Edition
games.description: Enhanced Edition brings all the depth and character of Divinity: Original Sin to the PlayStation 4 and Xbox One.

games.name: Dmc Devil May Cry: Definitive Edition
games.description: DmC Devil May Cry: Definitive Edition brings the same great game to PlayStation 4 and Xbox One.

games.name: Doki-Doki Universe
games.description: Doki-Doki Universe is unique and fun, even if it does get quite repetitive.

games.name: Don't Starve PS4
games.description: Don't Starve is a beautiful take on Minecraft's formula that ultimately left me feeling a bit too empty.

games.name: Doom VFR
games.description: Doom VFR is a brave shooter that proves that VR games don’t have to be conservative with movement to work.

games.name: Double Dragon 4
games.description: Double Dragon 4 is a retro brawler that leans too heavily on elements that haven't aged at all gracefully.

games.name: Dragon Age: Inquisition
games.description: Dragon Age: Inquisition doesn't spin a great tale, but it brings the series closer to its roots with deep RPG systems.

games.name: Dragon Age: Inquisition - The Descent
games.description: The Descent is a challenging yet unsatisfying experience that raises more questions than it answers.

games.name: Dragon Age: Inquisition - Trespasser
games.description: Trespasser is a decent send-off for the Inquisition.

games.name: Dragon Ball FighterZ
games.description: Dragon Ball FighterZ’s pairing of DBZ and Arc System Works is a match made in fighting game heaven.

games.name: Dragon Ball Xenoverse 2
games.description: Dragon Ball Xenoverse 2 is an ambitious , if rough-edged experience, with deceptively deep RPG and brawling elements.

games.name: Dragon Quest Builders
games.description: Dragon Quest Builders admirably mixes the series' RPG traditions with Minecraft.

games.name: Dragon Quest Heroes 2
games.description: Dragon Quest Heroes 2 brings back some old-school DQ flavor but stumbles over some dull non-combat elements.

games.name: Dragon Quest Heroes: The World Tree's Woe and the Blight Below
games.description: The joy of fighting defenseless creatures in Dragon Quest Heroes only lasts a short while.

games.name: Drawn to Death
games.description: Drawn to Death is a mean spirited, misguided mess that falls short mechanically and wants you to feel bad about yourself.

games.name: Dreadnought
games.description: Dreadnought's team-based spaceship action is slow paced but fun, at least until the progress slows to a crawl.

games.name: Driveclub
games.description: Fast, beautiful, and accessible, but a more modest, conventional arcade racer than its sprawling, open-world peers.

games.name: Driveclub VR
games.description: Driveclub VR helps demonstrate the potential of VR racing but it's definitely not the best way to play Driveclub.

games.name: Dying Light
games.description: High-speed parkour and gruesome zombie massacres make Dying Light a blast, even if the story's just okay.

games.name: Dynasty Warriors 9
games.description: Dynasty Warriors 9 moves the franchise in an ambitious new direction with a massive open world to explore, but that doesn’t mean it’s better.

games.name: EA Sports UFC
games.description: As great as it looks, EA Sports UFC fails to capture the high stakes excitement that makes MMA such a great sport.

games.name: EA Sports UFC 2
games.description: EA Sports' UFC 2 has some technical skill, but is missing the heart of the sport.

games.name: EVE Valkyrie
games.description: EVE Valkyrie benefits from VR's effect on its spacefighter combat, but its progression is stunted by microtransactions.

games.name: Eagle Flight
games.description: Eagle Flight surprised us with its comfortable and intuitive VR flight. It's slim on content, but fun while it lasts.

games.name: Elite Dangerous PS4
games.description: Elite Dangerous has some boring stretches, but if you're in this space sim for the long haul it's rewarding.

games.name: Enter the Gungeon
games.description: Enter the Gungeon's roguelike elements and vast array of crazy weapons keep it entertaining for the long haul.

games.name: Entwined
games.description: PS4's Entwined doesn't fully deliver on its promise. It's beautiful, but also frustrating.

games.name: Escape Plan PS4
games.description: PlayStation 4’s iteration of Escape Plan is just as fun as it was on Vita, and worthy of a purchase.

games.name: Everybody’s Gone to the Rapture
games.description: Everybody's Gone to the Rapture is a beautiful, heart-breaking journey into the end of the world.

games.name: Evolve
games.description: Tactically deep, and bursting with character, Evolve offers a level of nuance rarely found in multiplayer shooters.

games.name: Expand
games.description: Expand is a triumph of visual design and scoring that also boasts some clever design ideas.

games.name: F1 2015 PlayStation 4
games.description: With few features, annoying AI, and broken multiplayer, it's hard to appreciate F1 2015's improved driving.

games.name: F1 2016
games.description: Deep, nuanced, and packed with fan service, F1 2016 is definitively the best Formula One game from Codemasters to date.

games.name: F1 2017
games.description: A detailed and faithful ode to F1, F1 2017 is about as good a simulation of a single, modern motorsport as you can get.

games.name: FIFA 14
games.description: FIFA 14 on next-gen is a more refined, polished, and pleasing version of a brilliant sports game. Ready for extra time?

games.name: FIFA 15 PS4/Xbox One
games.description: FIFA 15 is still one of the best sports simulations around, with superb animation and big-match atmosphere.

games.name: FIFA 17
games.description: A terrific story mode and improved graphics make for a better game than last year though it’s behind PES on the pitch.

games.name: FIFA 18
games.description: A sharp focus on attack but few new additions make this a spectacular if somewhat shallow experience.

games.name: FIFA Soccer 16
games.description: Lacking fluidity and dynamism, football's reigning king has lost its crown.

games.name: Far Cry 4
games.description: Far Cry 4 has weak characters, but its campaign, co-op, and competitive multiplayer feature incredibly fun freedom.

games.name: Far Cry 4: Valley of the Yetis DLC
games.description: FC4’s Valley of the Yeti DLC adds some monstrous fun and desperate defense missions.

games.name: Far Cry 5
games.description: Far Cry 5 is another wide-open playground with all the necessary ingredients for causing a real ruckus: loads of enemies and allies, temperamental wildlife, and plenty of explosions.

games.name: Far Cry 5: Hours of Darkness DLC
games.description: Far Cry 5: Hours of Darkness works a few interesting ideas into its brief jaunt to Vietnam.

games.name: Farpoint
games.description: Fantastic gunplay and freedom of movement sets PSVR's Farpoint apart from most VR shooting galleries.

games.name: Fe
games.description: Fe is a lovely platformer with wonderful music, but it fails to do anything interesting with its best ideas.

games.name: Fez PC, PS3, PS4, & Vita
games.description: Fez is a brilliant, beautiful platformer. Play it immediately.

games.name: Final Fantasy Type-0 HD
games.description: Final Fantasy Type-0’s gritty tone and fast action is a welcome change of pace.

games.name: Final Fantasy X / X-2 HD Remaster PS4
games.description: Upgraded HD visuals make Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD Remaster on PS4 the best way to experience the world of Spira.

games.name: Final Fantasy XII: The Zodiac Age
games.description: Final Fantasy XII: The Zodiac Age offers a new look and a noteworthy gameplay revamp of an RPG classic.

games.name: Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn
games.description: Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn has launched with a great class system and amazing promise

games.name: Final Fantasy XV
games.description: Final Fantasy XV takes some risks that don't always pay off, but the strong quartet of heroes give it tons of heart.

games.name: Firewatch
games.description: Firewatch is among the best of the "walking simulators" thanks to stellar writing, art direction, and voice acting.

games.name: FlatOut 4: Total Insanity
games.description: FlatOut 4: Total Insanity is a respectable franchise rescue mission but it needs some fine tuning and some extra grunt.

games.name: Flower PS4
games.description: Flower on PS4 is even better and more beautiful than the phenomenal, unforgettable original.

games.name: For Honor
games.description: Despite dents in the armor, For Honor has one of the most complete melee combat systems I've ever experienced.

games.name: Fortnite Battle Royale
games.description: Thanks to the freedom of its outstanding building mechanic, Fortnite Battle Royale isn’t just a great battle royale game – it’s one of the best multiplayer games in recent history.

games.name: Full Throttle Remastered
games.description: Full Throttle Remastered's improved looks and sounds make it a great way to experience a classic comedy adventure.

games.name: GALAK-Z
games.description: While not a full-fledged roguelike, GALAK-Z's superb controls and charming personality make it great.

games.name: GTA 5 PlayStation 4 and Xbox One
games.description: GTA 5's amazing world looks and feels at home on new-gen hardware, and it's one of the best games available today.

games.name: Game of Thrones: Episode 1 – Iron from Ice
games.description: Game of Thrones Ep 1: Iron from Ice is a strong start for Telltale's adventure in George R. R. Martin's fantasy world.

games.name: Gauntlet: Slayer Edition
games.description: Gauntlet: Slayer Edition is a bit light on content, but that doesn't keep its improved combat from being a good time.

games.name: God of War
games.description: God of War’s outstanding characters, world, and combat come together to form an unforgettable adventure.

games.name: God of War 3 Remastered
games.description: God of War 3 Remastered's update is mostly visual, but the action reminds us why we love this bloody series.

games.name: Godzilla: The Game
games.description: Due to tedious gameplay and lackluster visuals, Godzilla fails to live up to his title of King of the Monsters.

games.name: Gone Home
games.description: Gone Home is a remarkable first-person adventure that tells one of the finest stories I've ever experienced in games.

games.name: Gran Turismo Sport
games.description: GT Sport looks great, feels good, and the online racing is well done, but it’s just not as complete as its competitors.

games.name: Gravity Rush 2
games.description: Kat’s return in Gravity Rush 2 is refreshed by the great new gravity styles and excellent side activities.

games.name: Grim Fandango Remastered
games.description: Time has done little to diminish Grim Fandango’s beauty or relevance. It is an adventure game not to be missed.

games.name: Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition
games.description: Guacamelee! is as amazing as ever. And now that it's migrated to nearly every platform, everyone can enjoy it.

games.name: Guilty Gear Xrd -SIGN-
games.description: Imaginative characters, complex battles, and a killer soundtrack are just a few good reasons to love Guilty Gear Xrd.

games.name: Guitar Hero Live
games.description: A smartly redesigned controller and addictive song streaming makes Guitar Hero Live a largely enjoyable music game.

games.name: Hardware: Rivals
games.description: There is fun to be had, but the novelty of Hardware: Rivals wears thin pretty quickly.

games.name: Harmonix Music VR
games.description: This collection of musical mini-games is the last thing you'd want to show your friends on your new $400 VR headset.

games.name: Has Been Heroes
games.description: Has Been Heroes has good ideas, but eventually, its extreme luck-based difficulty and repetition wear it down.

games.name: Hatoful Boyfriend PS4
games.description: Hatoful Boyfriend on Vita has some technical issues, but both versions still hatch a great story with a cool new bird.

games.name: Headlander
games.description: Headlander is an unexpectedly great take on Metroidviania-style action.

games.name: Heavy Rain - PlayStation 4 Edition
games.description: A great port, but six years on Heavy Rain has dated in some fundamental areas.

games.name: Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice
games.description: An incredible atmospheric story reinforces Hellblade's serious subject matter in this vivid tale of harrowing darkness.

games.name: Helldivers
games.description: Brutal, focused, and mechanically rich, Helldivers is one of the best co-op action experiences you can have.

games.name: Here They Lie
games.description: Here They Lie has a few scares in VR, but its overdone surrealism and poor execution fail to create any real horror.

games.name: Hitman Episode 1: Paris
games.description: Hitman: Episode 1 combines the best of Absolution and Blood Money and is a fun, confident start to the season.

games.name: Hitman Episode 2: Sapienza
games.description: Hitman Episode 2: Sapienza is a fantastic follow-up to the promising debut ep; huge and bursting with deadly promise.

games.name: Hitman Episode 3: Marrakesh
games.description: Hitman Episode 3: Marrakesh doesn’t reach the highs of the previous levels and features the worst voice acting so far.

games.name: Hitman Episode 4: Bangkok
games.description: Hitman Episode 4: Bangkok is a step up from the bland previous episode. Smaller, but plenty of murderous mayhem awaits.

games.name: Hitman Episode 5: Colorado
games.description: Hitman Episode 5: Colorado is the trickiest hit this season but this gloomy farm isn’t an especially memorable setting.

games.name: Hitman Episode 6: Hokkaido
games.description: Hitman Episode 6: Hokkaido is easily one of the best levels this season. Atmospheric and tricky.

games.name: Hohokum
games.description: A vibrant and delightful playground that will surprise you at every turn.

games.name: Hollow Knight
games.description: Hollow Knight’s rich world and incredible depth of content will make you want to explore its caves for dozens of hours.

games.name: Homefront: The Revolution
games.description: Homefront: The Revolution gets a few things right, but comes up short on story, substance, and gameplay.

games.name: Horizon Zero Dawn
games.description: Horizon Zero Dawn presents us with a beautiful world full of unforgettable challenges.

games.name: Horizon Zero Dawn: The Frozen Wilds
games.description: The Frozen Wilds is a great 15-hour experience that reminded me just how wonderful this world is.

games.name: I Am Setsuna
games.description: I Am Setsuna has some combat balance issues, but that doesn't keep it from delivering a highly emotional tale.

games.name: Iconoclasts
games.description: Iconoclasts' intricate Metroid-style puzzles and gorgeous 16-bit style art make it a memorable platformer with a distinct style.

games.name: Infamous: First Light
games.description: Infamous: First Light gives us more of the great action of Second Son, but doesn’t have the same super-powered variety.

games.name: Infamous: Second Son
games.description: Second Son is a departure in tone for the Infamous series, but its superpowered action lives up to expectations.

games.name: Injustice 2
games.description: Faster, deeper action and a wealth of content make this DC heroes fighting game feel super.

games.name: Injustice 2: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles DLC
games.description: Injustice 2's TMNT DLC pack is four distinct characters for the price of one, and great fanservice, too.

games.name: Injustice: Gods Among Us Ultimate Edition
games.description: Injustice: Gods Among Us Ultimate Edition is the most complete, best-looking version of the great DC brawler.

games.name: Inside
games.description: Inside is a 2D puzzle platformer that builds upon what made Limbo great, and in fact builds something greater.

games.name: J-Stars Victory Vs.+
games.description: Despite a great cast of characters, J-Stars Victory Vs.+ fails to leverage their charm on or off the battlefield.

games.name: Job Simulator PlayStation VR
games.description: Job Simulator is a VR funhouse that's all about goofy experimentation, interactivity, and laughs.

games.name: Journey PS4
games.description: Three years later, Journey remains one of the most powerful games in recent memory.

games.name: Jurassic World Evolution
games.description: After careful consideration, I've decided not to endorse Jurassic World Evolution's park.

games.name: Just Cause 3 Xbox One and PlayStation 4
games.description: When the action gets hot, the PS4 and Xbox One can't deliver the performance Just Cause 3 needs to be fun.

games.name: Just Dance 2014 PS4
games.description: Just Dance 2014 is still daft fun on PS4, but other versions have more to offer.

games.name: Kerbal Space Program PS4
games.description: This goofy space-flight sim has the right stuff.

games.name: Killing Floor 2
games.description: While a little thin on variety, Killing Floor 2's interesting classes and fast-paced shooting are a bloody good time.

games.name: Killing Floor: Incursion
games.description: Immersive survival-horror shooter Killing Floor: Incursion delights in the tactile pleasures of VR.

games.name: Killzone: Shadow Fall
games.description: Killzone: Shadow Fall is a worthy game to purchase alongside your PlayStation 4.

games.name: King of Fighters 14
games.description: Dated graphics and dodgy netcode slow King of Fighters XIV down a bit, but it's still a deep, rewarding fighter.

games.name: Kingdom Hearts HD 2.8 Final Chapter Prologue
games.description: A great glimpse at what’s to come, but the return to the past is an at-times unsatisfying appetizer.

games.name: Knack
games.description: Knack's shifting size is a great idea that never really grows into anything substantial.

games.name: Knack 2
games.description: Knack 2 is a significant improvement over the original, but still badly needs more interesting characters.

games.name: LEGO City Undercover
games.description: LEGO City Undercover remains a colourful open world stuffed with gameplay, and now it can be enjoyed by two.

games.name: LEGO Dimensions
games.description: LEGO Dimensions’ great characters and fun references consistently left me with a big dumb grin on my face.

games.name: LEGO Marvel Super Heroes
games.description: Face front, True Believers! Lego Marvel is the best thing to happen to Marvel games in years.

games.name: LEGO Marvel Superheroes 2
games.description: LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 doesn't change much from the LEGO formula, but rarely has the variety been so satisfying.

games.name: LEGO Marvel's Avengers
games.description: LEGO Marvel's Avengers is fun, but unfortunately restricted by stubbornly sticking to the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

games.name: LEGO Star Wars: The Force Awakens
games.description: LEGO Star Wars: The Force Awakens is the most gaming fun I’ve had with either series in years.

games.name: LawBreakers
games.description: LawBreakers is a fast-paced shooter with a sky high skill cap and an occasionally frustrating matchmaker.

games.name: Lego Batman 3 Beyond Gotham
games.description: Lego Batman 3 has loads of great DC characters and missions, but suffers from an inconsistent tone.

games.name: Lego The Hobbit
games.description: A fun and charming extension of the film that nevertheless suffers from some disjointed story problems and some sameness of characters.

games.name: Let it Die
games.description: Let It Die's outrageously weird sense of style help it overcome some of its gameplay issues, but only for so long.

games.name: Life Is Strange -- Episode 3
games.description: Life Is Strange: Episode 3 takes a massive turn with a heartfelt and ambitious new story.

games.name: Life Is Strange -- Episode 4: Dark Room
games.description: Dark Room finally sets off the mystery but it’s the least consistent episode of Life Is Strange so far.

games.name: Little Nightmares
games.description: Gleefully strange, unceasingly grim, and quietly smart, Little Nightmares is a very welcome fresh take on horror.

games.name: LittleBigPlanet 3
games.description: A beautifully-designed game with a great creation toolkit, LittleBigPlanet 3 is let down by unimaginative co-op & bugs.

games.name: Loadout PlayStation 4
games.description: Loadout's fast-paced shooting is worth a free download, but you might not want to crack your PSN wallet to progress.

games.name: Lost Sphear
games.description: Lost Sphear is so cluttered with homages to classic RPGs that it fails to create an identity of its own.

games.name: MLB 14: The Show
games.description: MLB: The Show 14 is still a great baseball sim, but this year's game doesn't have much new stuff to get excited about.

games.name: MLB 15: The Show
games.description: MLB 15: The Show is an excellent, complete package, but there are no game-changing new features this year.

games.name: MLB The Show 16
games.description: Simply put, MLB The Show 16 is the best baseball game available on any current-gen console.

games.name: MLB The Show 17
games.description: It's a career year for the only AAA baseball sim left on any platform.

games.name: MLB The Show 18
games.description: Between the foul lines, MLB The Show 18 is better than ever; but some of its main modes of play are left on the bench or out of the game.

games.name: Mad Max
games.description: Mad Max is an engaging rampage through a brutal world of depravity and loss that urges you to probe every ugly corner.

games.name: Madden NFL 15
games.description: Madden NFL 15’s defense revamp goes a long way toward reviving the excitement of football.

games.name: Madden NFL 16
games.description: Madden NFL 16's new throwing and passing game ramps up the risk, reward, and realism in new, exciting ways.

games.name: Madden NFL 17
games.description: With reinvigorated defense and gameplay styles that match the real teams, Madden NFL 17 returns the series to glory.

games.name: Madden NFL 18
games.description: The shift to Frostbite doesn't refresh Madden NFL 18's gameplay much, but Longshot is a memorable single-player mode.

games.name: Madden NFL 25 Xbox One and PlayStation 4
games.description: Next-gen graphics only go so far – changes to Madden 25's play make control tougher, though it's still good football.

games.name: Mafia 3
games.description: Mafia 3's fantastic story and characters are held down by some familiar, uninspired gameplay.

games.name: Magicka 2
games.description: Though it may occasionally test your patience, Magicka 2's charm and depth make it a really fun co-op experience.

games.name: Marvel Vs Capcom: Infinite
games.description: Marvel Vs. Capcom: Infinite's poor art style and story give the excellent fighting game underneath a bad name.

games.name: Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy: The Telltale Series, Episode 1: Tangled Up in Blue
games.description: Ep 1 of Telltale's Guardians of the Galaxy series hits most of the right notes to capture the spirit of comic and film.

games.name: Matterfall
games.description: Matterfall's action packed ride is over all too soon, but it's a blast while it lasts.

games.name: Mega Man Legacy Collection
games.description: Mega Man Legacy Collection combines great emulation, remixes, and historic context into a superb compilation.

games.name: Mega Man Legacy Collection 2
games.description: Mega Man Legacy Collection 2's games are fun and frustrating to revisit.

games.name: Mercenary Kings
games.description: Mercenary Kings is old-school, yet modern, providing players with a difficult and rewarding side-scrolling shooter.

games.name: Metal Gear Solid 5: Ground Zeroes
games.description: While short, a Metal Gear game has never looked or played as good as Ground Zeroes. Bring on The Phantom Pain.

games.name: Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain
games.description: Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain is a gameplay marvel, rewarding intelligence and creativity in a way few games do.

games.name: Metal Gear Survive
games.description: Despite losing the soul of the series, there's fun in Metal Gear Survive's resource-gathering, base-building loop and co-op action.

games.name: Metro: Redux
games.description: Packing in two remastered adventures and tons of bonus content, Metro: Redux is Moscow's underworld at its best.

games.name: Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor
games.description: Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor's great action and dynamic enemies make both victory and defeat an amazing experience.

games.name: Middle-earth: Shadow of War - Blade of Galadriel DLC
games.description: Middle-earth: Shadow of War - Blade of Galadriel removes the most interesting part of the main game and replaces it with some just-okay new moves.

games.name: Mighty No. 9
games.description: Charmless and full of poorly-executed ideas, Mighty No. 9 fails to entertain despite its legendary pedigree.

games.name: Minecraft PS4 and Xbox One
games.description: Minecraft on PS4 and Xbox One is the same amazing game, but with even bigger worlds than we've see on consoles before.

games.name: Mirror's Edge Catalyst
games.description: Mirror’s Edge’s return shines in some regards, but is ultimately a disappointment.

games.name: Monster Hunter: World
games.description: Bold and newly beautiful, Monster Hunter: World demands to be played on its own terms and rewards you with an amazing RPG.

games.name: Mortal Kombat X
games.description: Great new characters, and sharper gameplay hooks make Mortal Kombat X the best game in the series.

games.name: Moss
games.description: Quill and her fantastical world of Moss are instantly likable. This storybook action-adventure makes stellar use of VR.

games.name: MouseCraft
games.description: MouseCraft made me feel like a mad scientist as I used tetris bricks to lead mice through thoughtful puzzles.

games.name: Murdered: Soul Suspect
games.description: Murdered: Soul Suspect has a lot of great ideas, but none of them come together in a satisfying way.

games.name: NBA 2K14
games.description: NBA 2K14 on PS4 & Xbox One is not only a great basketball game, it's a showcase for your new console.

games.name: NBA 2K15
games.description: Like a great player toughing it out through an injury, NBA 2K15 is still strong despite crippling server problems.

games.name: NBA 2K16
games.description: NBA 2K16 is a leap forward in defensive AI, online stability, and overall polish. This is amazing basketball.

games.name: NBA 2K17
games.description: In NBA 2K17 the focus is on chaining moves and customization, and it pays off.

games.name: NBA 2K18
games.description: NBA 2K18 impresses by making players behave more like their real-life counterparts than ever before.

games.name: NBA Live '15
games.description: Don't let the improved looks fool you – NBA Live 15's good ideas are all stifled by poor gameplay fundamentals.

games.name: NBA Live 14
games.description: NBA Live 14 marks the return of the once-excellent basketball sim, but that excellence is long gone.

games.name: NBA Live 16
games.description: NBA Live 16 can only go so far with clumsy controls holding it back.

games.name: NBA Live 18
games.description: While NBA Live 18’s gameplay is a significant upgrade, its shallow game modes fall well short of the competition.

games.name: NHL 15
games.description: NHL 15 is fun to play and pretty to look at, but it's disappointingly light on modes to keep you hooked on hockey.

games.name: NHL 16
games.description: NHL 16 brings the series back up to speed with some great modes and features, but you can’t count on its online modes.

games.name: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm
games.description: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm's strong combat is countered hard by poor AI and connection problems.

games.name: Natural Doctrine
games.description: With its unfair gameplay and messy combat, Natural Doctrine is nothing more than a tedious, rage-inducing nightmare.

games.name: Need for Speed
games.description: Need for Speed looks and sounds great, but beneath its flashy exterior it’s not quite firing on all cylinders.

games.name: Need for Speed Rivals
games.description: Fast, furious, and fun. NFS: Rivals blends Hot Pursuit and Most Wanted to great effect.

games.name: Nex Machina
games.description: Nex Machina is a great-looking, fast-paced, and challenging twin-stick shooter.

games.name: Ni No Kuni 2: Revenant Kingdom
games.description: Revenant Kingdom delivers in pacing and scope, but is let down by a lack of character development and challenge.

games.name: Night in the Woods
games.description: Night in the Woods' exploration of young adulthood manages to be charming, funny, and devastatingly sad all at once.

games.name: Octodad: Dadliest Catch PS4
games.description: Octodad revels in its brand of absurdist physical comedy, but also tells a touching tale.

games.name: Oddworld: New 'N' Tasty
games.description: New 'n' Tasty is a fantastic way to rediscover a cleverly designed, grotesquely beautiful puzzle-platforming classic.

games.name: Odin Sphere: Leifthrasir
games.description: A brilliant remake brings Odin Sphere: Leifthrasir to its full action-RPG potential.

games.name: OlliOlli 2: Welcome to Olliwood
games.description: A superbly crafted and challenging technical skating game.

games.name: One Piece: Burning Blood
games.description: One Piece: Burning Blood is a bit too much for the uninitiated, and a bit too little for One Piece stalwarts.

games.name: One Piece: Pirate Warriors 3
games.description: Pirate Warriors 3 combines musou combat with One Piece’s spirit intact, but it’s bogged down by cutscenes.

games.name: Onrush
games.description: Onrush makes its mark by making you forget everything you thought you knew about racing games. Its a never-ending stampede of exciting chaos.

games.name: Outlast
games.description: Outlast stands proudly as a unique and terrifying survival horror game.

games.name: Outlast: Whistleblower
games.description: Outlast: Whistleblower's hellish adventure is still scary, but relies too heavily on the same old tricks.

games.name: Oxenfree
games.description: Oxenfree's beautiful coming-of-age story is slowed down by pacing issues.

games.name: PES 2017
games.description: Slick gameplay, smart AI, and great online make PES 2017 a great all-round football game.

games.name: PES 2018
games.description: Once again, PES has set an incredibly high level of quality for other sports games to try and match.

games.name: PS4 Pro
games.description: Powerful and premium-feeling, the PS4 Pro has a lot of potential, but needs more uniform support to truly shine.

games.name: Payday 2: Crimewave Edition
games.description: Payday 2: Crimewave Edition doesn't look all that great, but it plays better than ever this time around.

games.name: Peggle 2
games.description: Peggle 2 is a joyful follow-up to one of the best puzzle games ever made.

games.name: Perception
games.description: A great idea squandered on a dull game, Perception's execution repeatedly fails to match its ambition.

games.name: Persona 5
games.description: A gorgeous, vibrant world and captivating story make Persona 5 a new gold standard for Japanese RPGs.

games.name: Pillars of Eternity: Complete Edition
games.description: Other than its epic load times, this console port of Pillars of Eternity lives up to the outstanding PC version.

games.name: Pinball Arcade
games.description: Pinball Arcade is an excellent starting point for re-experiencing the golden days of quarter-munchers.

games.name: PlanetSide 2 PS4
games.description: PlanetSide 2's massive-scale multiplayer warfare takes some getting used to, but it's a battle well worth fighting.

games.name: Plants Vs Zombies: Garden Warfare 2
games.description: Plants vs Zombies Garden Warfare 2 is a great online shooter with an unexpected wealth of single-player stuff, too.

games.name: PlayStation VR Worlds
games.description: Of the five VR experiences in PlayStation VR Worlds, only The London Heist stands out.

games.name: Prey
games.description: Prey's space station is fantastically explorable and its shape-shifting enemies maintain tension when combat doesn't.

games.name: Pro Evolution Soccer 2015
games.description: PES returns to the Premier League in its best iteration in years.

games.name: Pro Evolution Soccer 2016
games.description: Small but crucial improvements make PES 2016 a thrilling game of football.

games.name: Project CARS
games.description: Deep and demanding but incredibly user-friendly, Project CARS is real racing done right.

games.name: Project CARS 2
games.description: With its refined new handling and piles of race options, Project CARS 2 is about as good as real racing gets right now.

games.name: Psychonauts in the Rhombus of Ruin
games.description: Psychonauts in the Rhombus of Ruin is a fun, intuitive VR adventure with a great story.

games.name: Pure Chess PS4
games.description: Pure Chess is a noble effort, but fails to capture the true essence of chess with lackluster online play.

games.name: Puyo Puyo Tetris
games.description: Mashing two great things together doesn't always work, but Tetris and Puyo Puyo are a great fit in Puyo Puyo Tetris.

games.name: Pyre
games.description: The stars of deep tactical gameplay and memorable story choices align in Pyre.

games.name: RAID: WWII
games.description: Raid: WWII is a monotonous, dated co-op shooter. It can be fun with a crew of friends, but there are better options.

games.name: Rain World
games.description: Rain World nails its oppressive world, but its beauty can't compensate for a design that works against the player.

games.name: Rainbow Six Siege
games.description: Rainbow Six Siege is a blast – sometimes literally – but it's plagued by progression issues & a bit lacking in content.

games.name: Ratchet and Clank
games.description: Ratchet and Clank is a culmination of everything Insomniac has done with the series over the past 14 years.

games.name: Rayman Legends
games.description: Rayman Legends is bursting with creative platforming and fresh ideas.

games.name: Resident Evil
games.description: Resident Evil does a good job of updating the look and feel of a classic survival horror game for a new audience.

games.name: Resogun
games.description: Resogun is a smart, speedy game that reinvigorates the shoot ‘em up genre.

games.name: Resogun Heroes DLC
games.description: PlayStation 4's finest gameplay experience is back with a vengeance with Resogun's Heroes DLC.

games.name: Rez Infinite
games.description: With or without the PlayStation VR, Rez Infinite is a trippy, imaginative rail-shooter with a visual style all its own.

games.name: Rigs: Mechanized Combat League
games.description: Rigs: Mechanized Combat League delivers fast, intense multiplayer action to PlayStation VR, but with some caveats.

games.name: Rime
games.description: Rime is a beautiful but shallow puzzle-platformer that's a bit too derivative.

games.name: Rise of the Tomb Raider: 20 Year Celebration
games.description: An enduring, enthralling adventure packed in with a few neat additions round out an already amazing game.

games.name: Robinson: The Journey
games.description: Frustrating controls keep Robinson: The Journey from being much more than a pretty dinosaur exhibit.

games.name: Rock Band 4
games.description: Rock Band 4 makes smart choices in bringing the series back, even if its setlist is somewhat disappointing.

games.name: Rocket League
games.description: Rocket League is an energetic mashing of arcade driving and sports, with a sky-high skill ceiling and endless personality.

games.name: Rogue Legacy
games.description: A wildly inventive 2D Roguelike with a 30-second gameplay loop that lasts for 20 odd hours.

games.name: Rory McIlroy PGA Tour
games.description: Rory McIlroy PGA Tour is a disappointing golf game that just barely manages to make the cut.

games.name: Rugby 15
games.description: Rugby 15 has more bugs than Starship Troopers and is messier than school-yard mugby.

games.name: Rugby World Cup 2015
games.description: Sorry, rugby fans, this is a horrible, rushed release punted out the door in time for the World Cup.

games.name: Ruiner
games.description: Ruiner's stylish, frantic, twin-stick action only starts to feel good once it's all over.

games.name: Runner 3
games.description: The repetitive nature and dated graphics of Runner 3 bring down what's otherwise a really fun and rewarding experience.

games.name: SEGA Genesis Classics
games.description: SEGA Genesis Classics offers a good batch of games and some extra niceties, even if it's missing some first-party hits.

games.name: Saints Row IV: Re-Elected
games.description: Saints Row IV: Re-Elected is still an enjoyable, chaotic romp on PS4 and Xbox One, but its improvements are minimal.

games.name: Secret Ponchos
games.description: Secret Ponchos' seemingly simple gunplay is rewardingly deep, but its content is otherwise disappointingly shallow.

games.name: Shadow of the Beast
games.description: Bloody, elegant combat and an otherworldly vibe make Shadow of the Beast a successful reboot of the Amiga classic.

games.name: Shadow of the Colossus For PS4
games.description: Shadow of the Colossus on PS4 is a stunning return to the classic that wowed us in 2005.

games.name: Shantae: Half-Genie Hero
games.description: Smart level design, eye-popping colors, and unabashed charm make Shantae: Half Genie hero a strong action-platformer.

games.name: Sherlock Holmes: Crimes and Punishments
games.description: Sherlock Holmes: Crimes and Punishments dazzles visually, but disappoints with murky conclusions to its cases.

games.name: Sherlock Holmes: The Devil's Daughter
games.description: Sherlock Holmes: The Devil's Daughter has good mysteries, but the way you interact with them is rigid and limiting.

games.name: Shovel Knight
games.description: Shovel Knight -- in all of its old-school glory -- is arguably the best game released so far in 2014.

games.name: Skylanders Imaginators
games.description: My inner child was delighted by the creativity, but disappointed by aggressive microtransactions.

games.name: Skylanders SuperChargers
games.description: Skylanders SuperChargers gets a lot of mileage out of its new vehicles.

games.name: Skylanders Trap Team
games.description: Loads of great characters and the return of Skystones make Trap Team one of the best games in the Skylanders series.

games.name: Snake Pass
games.description: Snake Pass uses an intuitive control scheme to move like a serpent, but its wonky camera will test your patience.

games.name: Sniper Elite 4
games.description: Sniper Elite 4 is a smart, strategic shooter that empowers you to make your own path.

games.name: Sniper Elite III
games.description: More than just a showcase for slow-motion gore, Sniper Elite III shines for its open-ended approach to stealth.

games.name: Sniper: Ghost Warrior 3
games.description: Sniper: Ghost Warrior 3 misses the mark with a lack of distinguishing features and hits some technical landmines.

games.name: Song of the Deep
games.description: Insomniac's Song of the Deep is a beautiful Metroidvania robbed of much of its potential magic.

games.name: Sonic Forces
games.description: Sonic Forces has a few good ideas for how to move Sonic forward but doesn't build on their momentum.

games.name: Sonic Mania
games.description: Sonic Mania is the classic throwback longtime series fans have been clamoring for.

games.name: Sound Shapes
games.description: No matter where you play it, Sound Shapes is an astounding, unique experience.

games.name: South Park: The Fractured But Whole
games.description: South Park: The Fractured But Whole's excellent combat system pairs well with its true-to-the-show comedy.

games.name: Splatoon 2: Octo Expansion DLC
games.description: Splatoon 2's Octo Expansion provides a great and varied amount of challenges that will put your skills to the test.

games.name: Sportsfriends
games.description: With its deep, varied gameplay, Sportsfriends is the most exciting local multiplayer game since Wii Sports.

games.name: Star Ocean: Integrity and Faithlessness
games.description: The newest Star Ocean is a serviceable JPRG marred by uneven production values and poor A.I.

games.name: Star Trek: Bridge Crew
games.description: Star Trek: Bridge Crew takes us boldly into the VR frontier, but it lacks the depth and content for an extended voyage.

games.name: Star Wars Battlefront
games.description: Star Wars Battlefront captures the essence of the original trilogy, but applies it to an uneven set of modes.

games.name: Stardew Valley
games.description: Stardew Valley beautifully combines genres to create a captivating small-town life sim.

games.name: SteamWorld Dig 2
games.description: SteamWorld Dig 2 retains the core gameplay loop of digging for riches, but layers in stronger RPG elements.

games.name: SteamWorld Dig: A Fistful of Dirt
games.description: SteamWorld Dig's simple hook and hypnotic rhythm will keep you mining long into the night.

games.name: Steep
games.description: Steep is a fresh extreme sports journey through a huge map, slowed only by dull paragliding and a lack of progression.

games.name: Street Fighter 5: Arcade Edition
games.description: With Arcade Edition, Street Fighter 5 finally feels like a complete game, and one that lives up to its legacy.

games.name: Strider
games.description: Strider is an unbalanced yet extremely stylish platformer, and the series’ best game since the original.

games.name: Styx: Shards of Darkness
games.description: Styx: Shards of Darkness is a challenging stealth adventure with just as much snark as it has sneaking.

games.name: Submerged
games.description: Submerged is a non-violent, sometimes beautiful exploration adventure set in a strange, mysterious future.

games.name: Sundered
games.description: The random nature of Sundered sometimes works against it, but this 2D rogue-lite is an often beautiful challenge.

games.name: Super Mega Baseball
games.description: You don’t have to be an ‘80s kid or even a baseball fan to enjoy Super Mega Baseball.

games.name: Super Motherload
games.description: Super Motherload is perhaps PS4’s strangest launch title, but far from being its best.

games.name: Superhot VR
games.description: Superhot VR's time-warping action is an amazing use of virtual reality, creating the illusion of superhuman reflexes.

games.name: Superhypercube
games.description: Superhypercube is a triumphant arcade game that uses virtual reality in smart, subtle ways.

games.name: Sword Art Online: Hollow Realization
games.description: A lack of tangible stakes, and some muddled RPG systems dull the blades of Sword Art Online: Hollow Realization.

games.name: Sword Art Online: Lost Song
games.description: Repetitive combat, recycled enemies, and a boring story prevent this action RPG from taking off.

games.name: Tales from the Borderlands Episode 1: ZerO Sum
games.description: Tales from the Borderlands Episode 1 is a hilarious, fantastic start to Telltale's trip to Pandora

games.name: Tales of Berseria
games.description: It's good to be bad in Tales of Berseria, among the most emotional and darkest of this long-running RPG series.

games.name: Tales of Zestiria
games.description: An open-world map and fun new combat features make Tales of Zestiria an enjoyable roleplaying game.

games.name: Tearaway Unfolded
games.description: Tearaway Unfolded is fun and fizzes with ideas, even though some of the original's charm has been lost in translation.

games.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutants in Manhattan
games.description: Short, bland, and repetitive, TMNT: Mutants in Manhattan isn't worth playing for its few good gags.

games.name: Tekken 7
games.description: Tekken 7 is a hallmark fighting game that's both accessible and highly technical, with great customization options.

games.name: Telltale's Batman: The Enemy Within Episode 4 – What Ails You
games.description: The Enemy Within's penultimate episode is a no-frills adventure that starts to tie up the series's loose ends.

games.name: Tembo the Badass Elephant
games.description: Tembo stumbles at times, but its overall charm, and moments of rhythmic zen keep it fun throughout.

games.name: Tharsis
games.description: More interstellar slot machine than simulation, Tharsis relies far too heavily on randomization to be fun.

games.name: The Amazing Spider-Man 2 Game
games.description: It's super-fun to swing around New York City in The Amazing Spider-Man 2! Everything else, on the other hand...

games.name: The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth
games.description: The creepy-cute dungeons of The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth are amazingly different and challenging every time.

games.name: The Crew
games.description: The Crew is truly massive and packed with racing but it's let down by its dated appearance and frustrating AI.

games.name: The Elder Scrolls Online: Summerset
games.description: The Elder Scrolls Online returns to another nostalgic location in its Summerset expansion, finding excellent storytelling within.

games.name: The Elder Scrolls Online: Tamriel Unlimited
games.description: The Elder Scrolls Online: TU's combat handles well on a gamepad, making it a great way to experience all this content.

games.name: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Special Edition
games.description: Skyrim: Special Edition recaptures and beautifies the legendary RPG, but leaves room for an even-more-special edition.

games.name: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim VR
games.description: Skyrim VR is at once the best way to experience Skyrim and the worst way to play it.

games.name: The Evil Within
games.description: Superb gameplay, a breakneck pace and terrifying enemies makes The Evil Within a wonderful survival horror experience.

games.name: The Evil Within: The Assignment
games.description: The first part of The Evil Within's DLC is just as good as the main game, with some great twists to the formula.

games.name: The Golf Club
games.description: The Golf Club is a fun way to hit the links for golfing purists and would-be course creators.

games.name: The LEGO Movie Videogame
games.description: The LEGO Movie Videogame's diverse backdrops and heroes devolve into tedium and busywork.

games.name: The Last Guardian
games.description: The Last Guardian is a beautiful, melancholy game filled with the highest highs, and the lowest lows.

games.name: The Last of Us: Remastered
games.description: With The Last of Us: Remastered, PlayStation 3’s best game just became PlayStation 4’s, too.

games.name: The Order: 1886
games.description: Though a stylish adventure, The Order: 1886 emphasizes its cinematic polish at the crippling cost of gameplay freedom.

games.name: The Park
games.description: While it doesn't reinvent the wheel, The Park manages to deliver a ton of great scares.

games.name: The Sims 4 Xbox One and PlayStation 4
games.description: The Sims 4 for consoles would be as fun and addictive as the PC version if not for serious save, performance, and UI bugs.

games.name: The Surge
games.description: The Surge struggles to present a compelling campaign, but delivers a fun new take on a familiar genre.

games.name: The Swapper
games.description: The Swapper tempted me with ingenious puzzles and made me question mortality and morality in a way few games ever have.

games.name: The Tomorrow Children
games.description: The Tomorrow Children puts a stylish if superficial veneer on a familiar and repetitive game design format.

games.name: The Vanishing of Ethan Carter PS4
games.description: The Vanishing of Ethan Carter on PS4 is just as powerful and beautiful as its PC counterpart.

games.name: The Walking Dead: A Telltale Game Series -- Season 2
The Witcher 3
games.description: Massive in size, and meticulously detailed, The Witcher 3 ends Geralt's story on a high note.

games.name: The Witcher 3: Hearts of Stone
games.description: The Witcher 3: Hearts of Stone wraps an interesting story and great gameplay additions into one well-rounded expansion.

games.name: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt - Blood and Wine
games.description: Geralt gets a fitting sendoff in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt - Blood and Wine, courtesy of a strong cast and new items.

games.name: The Witness
games.description: A beautiful, powerful, and cleverly designed puzzle game with a wealth of mysteries to unravel.

games.name: Thief
games.description: Thief has good stealth going for it, but everything connecting its few relatively open scenarios is a mess.

games.name: Thumper
games.description: Thumper's trippy sights, sounds, and intense rhythm action create a terrifying VR experience I won't soon forget.

games.name: Tiny Brains
games.description: Tiny Brains is a puzzle game with an interesting premise smothered beneath frustrating mechanics and repetitive design.

games.name: Titan Attacks!
games.description: Titan Attacks is an enjoyable ode to Space Invaders, and a good way to waste some time on PS3, PS4, and Vita.

games.name: Titan Souls
games.description: Titan Souls' creative fights and fluid controls make for intensely satisfying and rewarding one-hit-kill combat.

games.name: Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition
games.description: TR: Definitive Edition’s good looks are a bonus. It’s still Lara, great pacing, and clever design that make it amazing.

games.name: Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 5
games.description: Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 5’s rare moments of nostalgic joy are drowned out by its abundance of faults.

games.name: Torment: Tides of Numenera
games.description: Torment: Tides of Numenera delivers a deep and satisfyingly strange RPG world loaded with text-based storytelling.

games.name: TowerFall Ascension
games.description: Towerfall’s fun multiplayer sets up hilarious face-offs with your friends.

games.name: Trackmania Turbo
games.description: Trackmania Turbo is fast, frenetic, fun, and only occasionally frustrating. A brilliant arcade stunt racer.

games.name: Transformers Devastation
games.description: Transformers Devastation’s nostalgia-fueled fisticuffs are a fun way to revisit the classic TV show.

games.name: Transformers: Rise of the Dark Spark
games.description: A good Transformers game has good transforming and good robot-blasting. Rise of the Dark Spark has neither.

games.name: Transistor
games.description: Transistor is a wildly smart action-RPG that places all of its trust into your intelligence.

games.name: Trials Fusion
games.description: Trials Fusion’s precision controls and exacting challenge make it a great pickup for leaderboard perfectionists.

games.name: Trials of The Blood Dragon
games.description: Trials of the Blood Dragon has a handful of insanely great stunt moments, but also some bad on-foot sections.

games.name: Trove
games.description: Trove is a blocky Minecraft-style MMO that's best in short bursts but grinds in the long run.

games.name: Tumble VR
games.description: Some of Tumble VR's puzzles are clever, but at the end of the day, we're just stacking blocks.

games.name: Umbrella Corps
games.description: Umbrella Corps is a black mark on the Resident Evil series' record.

games.name: Uncharted 4: A Thief's End
games.description: Peerless visuals, slick gameplay and a confident story make Nathan Drake's final adventure one to remember.

games.name: Uncharted: The Lost Legacy
games.description: Uncharted: The Lost Legacy succeeds on the strength of its characters and writing.

games.name: Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection
games.description: Every game in Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection has aged well, thanks to an excellent visual remaster.

games.name: Undertale
games.description: It might not be pretty, but Undertale is absolutely a work of art.

games.name: Unravel
games.description: Unravel combines nature and nostalgia to great effect in this moving puzzle adventure.

games.name: Unravel Two
games.description: Unravel Two improves on the original in almost every respect, with better platforming and puzzles.

games.name: Until Dawn
games.description: Until Dawn is an inconsistent horror game, but it's still a heck of a lot of fun.

games.name: Until Dawn: Rush of Blood
games.description: Until Dawn: Rush of Blood lacks scares or thrills as a rail shooter, but there's some fun in its arcade-style shooting.

games.name: Valiant Hearts: The Great War
games.description: Valiant Hearts is an adventure more interested in exploring the effects of war, than having you re-enact the violence.

games.name: Valkyria Chronicles Remastered
games.description: Both beautiful and unique, Valkyria Chronicles Remastered looks and plays great alongside contemporary strategy games.

games.name: Valkyria Revolution
games.description: Valkyria Revolution tells a decent tale of war but offers little in the way of strategy.

games.name: Valley
games.description: Fun, fast, first-person platforming that's spaced too far apart by empty environments and forgettable combat.

games.name: Vampyr
games.description: Despite some technical issues and systems that are undercut by a lack of difficulty, Vampyr is a genuine, good vampire story in a well-realized world.

games.name: Velocity 2X
games.description: Velocity 2X successfully  builds upon the speed of the original with its awesome new side-scrolling sections.

games.name: Volume
games.description: A few easy levels can't overshadow the sheer amount of Volume's content and variety.

games.name: WRC 6
games.description: WRC 6 remains outclassed by Dirt Rally but its long, narrow stages help make it the best WRC game in a decade.

games.name: WRC 7
games.description: WRC 7's career runs out of surprises but it’s worth playing for its excellent courses, especially its huge Epic Stages.

games.name: WWE 2K15 PlayStation 4 and Xbox One
games.description: WWE 2K15 looks better and hits harder on new-gen, but some key omissions keep it from reaching the main-event.

games.name: WWE 2K16
games.description: WWE 2K16 is a true in-ring technician, and its feature set has taken a big step in the right direction.

games.name: WWE 2K17
games.description: The loss of the 2K Showcase is unfortunate, but WWE 2K17s gameplay tweaks, and already strong feature-set save the day.

games.name: WWE 2K18
games.description: WWE 2K18's new graphics engine makes a big frog splash, but the dull MyCareer mode may put you in a sleeper hold.

games.name: War Thunder
games.description: War Thunder soars high, even with the weight of its bloated menus holding it down.

games.name: Warframe PlayStation 4
games.description: Warframe's great co-op combat is a big draw, but its repetition and free-to-play model limit the fun.

games.name: Warhammer 40K: Inquisitor - Martyr
games.description: Blasting through the grim world of Warhammer 40K always has appeal, but bizarre itemization and repetitive combat bring Inquisitor - Martyr down a few notches.

games.name: Warhammer: End Times - Vermintide
games.description: Vermintide is a competent, Warhammer-flavored twist on the Left 4 Dead formula.

games.name: Wasteland 2: Director's Cut
games.description: Wasteland 2: Director's Cut is strong console adaptation of a great old-school roleplaying game.

games.name: Watch Dogs
games.description: Watch Dogs is an excellent open-world action game with some unique hacking-magic that makes it a memorable experience.

games.name: Wayward Sky
games.description: With strong art direction, and a solid grasp of what makes VR absorbing, Wayward Sky is a warm, simple pleasure.

games.name: Werewolves Within
games.description: Werewolves Within is an engrossing, friendly, social VR experience that's let down by some seriously inhibiting bugs.

games.name: What Remains of Edith Finch
games.description: What Remains of Edith Finch is a gorgeous experience and one of the finest magical-realism stories in all of games

games.name: Whispering Willows
games.description: Despite some good ideas and cool design choices, Whispering Willows can't deliver a wholly fulfilling experience.

games.name: Wolfenstein 2: The New Colossus
games.description: The excellent shooting action in Wolfenstein: The New Colossus is paired with a fantastically written and acted story.

games.name: Wolfenstein: The New Order
games.description: Wolfenstein: The New Order's emphasis on storytelling and characters make it a shooter worth playing.

games.name: Wolfenstein: The Old Blood
games.description: Wolfenstein: The Old Blood doubles down on blood and guts, but in doing so sacrifices some of its heart.

games.name: Wonder Boy: The Dragon's Trap
games.description: It may be a bit dated, but this great-looking remake of a wacky classic is still engaging and fun after 30 years.

games.name: World of Final Fantasy
games.description: World of Final Fantasy's adorable critters make up for its lack of exploration and repetitive combat.

games.name: Worms WMD
games.description: Don't overlook Worms WMD. These cute-looking creatures are big fun on the battlefield.

games.name: Yakuza 0
games.description: Yakuza 0 is a big, bold and bruising tour through the Japanese underworld.

games.name: Yakuza 6: The Song of Life
games.description: Yakuza 6’s story is another satisfying serving of the Japanese crime saga, but its gameplay is short on substance.

games.name: Yakuza Kiwami
games.description: Yakuza Kiwami gives the first game in the Japanese underworld series a quality makeover, but leaves a lot on the table.

games.name: Yoku's Island Express
games.description: Yoku’s Island Express is a novel Metroidvania-pinball hybrid that stands as something wholly unique and incredibly fun.

emptyFields.name: Mighty No. 9
emptyFields.description: Charmless and full of poorly-executed ideas, Mighty No. 9 fails to entertain despite its legendary pedigree.

emptyFields.name: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Special Edition
emptyFields.description: Skyrim: Special Edition recaptures and beautifies the legendary RPG, but leaves room for an even-more-special edition.

emptyFields.name: Valkyria Chronicles Remastered
emptyFields.description: Both beautiful and unique, Valkyria Chronicles Remastered looks and plays great alongside contemporary strategy games.

emptyFields.name: The Walking Dead: A Telltale Game Series -- Season 2
Fortnite Battle Royale
emptyFields.description: Thanks to the freedom of its outstanding building mechanic, Fortnite Battle Royale isn’t just a great battle royale game – it’s one of the best multiplayer games in recent history.

emptyFields.name: The Last of Us: Remastered
emptyFields.description: With The Last of Us: Remastered, PlayStation 3’s best game just became PlayStation 4’s, too.
